Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Sabiha Gokcen airport”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at the Crowne Plaza Istanbul Asia on a business trip last week. The hotel is an excellent quality property located close to Sabiha Gokcen airport and attached to the large Viaport shopping mall complex. The drive to/from Ataturk Airport can be 60-90 minutes depending on bridge traffic so budget accordingly. Facilities are international standard as is to be expected of a Crowne Plaza. Wireless internet is free and reasonably fast but has a convoluted login process that the front desk will explain. The only issue with the stay was that one of our group was charged for items he didn't consume from the mini-bar and the front desk staff refused to remove them from the bill until the manager got involved. It was sorted out in the end but it left a slightly poor impression of what was otherwise an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel - expensive food & drinks”
Reviews.Author: gabsterUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful - everything is of a high quality - rooms are well equipped and elegant. Used the hotel, spa, pool & gym - first class facilities. Unlike previous reviewer, I had no language problems except an amusing conversation with the young waitress at breakfast (two and tea sound very similar) The hotel offer a free shuttle to and from the nearby Sabiha airport (carefull, Istanbul has 2 airports an hour apart!) My only criticism was the price of food and especially drink! â‚¬3 for water & coke, â‚¬7 for 1/2 a beer! If you walk towards the lake in the Mall next to the hotel (exit hotel at -2 level) there are several restaurants that charge normal prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great Value and beats many other 5 Stars !!”
Reviews.Author: Effem83
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by what I got from this hotel in terms of value v/s the price I paid for it. I travelled in August 2011 and it was GREAT VALUE ! The restaurant downstairs is fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business trip in Eastern Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: crazyfrench
Reviews.Content: Quite new hotel, located next to an outlet mall and amusement center. Due to its location (almost 2h drive to the center of Istanbul with "regular" traffic jam), it is more dedicated to business trips in this area (Eastern Istanbul, Gebzeâ€¦). I stayed one week in the 8th floor (executive one). Good services (laundry, room service, reception able to speak proper Englishâ€¦). +: Nice room, modern bathroom, free wifi -: Prices of the food and beverages (11 TRY, almost 5 EUR for an expresso !), food or beverage bought outside (in the shopping mall for example) are forbidden

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Kassiopea
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious room.Relatively close to the Sabiha Gohcen airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable hotel for business in Istanbul Asian Area”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: This hotel have a grat level ofquality and a reasonable price. Wonderful gym and sauna. The hotel is connected to a mall with some small resturant and several shop. Note this hotel is far from Old istanbul but very close to SAW airport (not Ataturk). The hotel is a real 5-star bran new.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities but far away from town”
Reviews.Author: ConnieIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent facilities. Spacious rooms, health spa, indoor pool. However, its location is only suitable for people who have either business in the area or are transitting from Sabiha airport, the second airport in Istanbul. Depending on traffic, it can take up to 1.5 hours by taxi to Istanbul down town. Breakfast is buffet style and very nice, great selection. The hotel restaurant is a bit formal and the bar is inside the restaurant and not on its own. The hotel is situated right next to a huge outlet shopping mall. The staff overall are very friendly and like to please.

Reviews.Title: “No English speakers and no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel infrastructure itself is very nice. I struggled to communicate in English with the hotel staff. They very kindly upgraded me to a suite when I checked in, but then the key didn't work in the door and after struggling to communicate this and three keys coming and not working they downgraded me back to a normal room!!! The aircon was on in the rooms but it was not cooling, although the hotel lobby was like a refrigerator. I did try to ask about this too, language barrier problems again. The hotel is next to very large shopping mall, again no-one spoke English not even the young people working in the restaurants and stores so I guess this is a local issue. They dont appear to have much tourism in this area so that may explain it. For a Crowne Plaza hotel I think they could do better on the language front with some staff training!

Reviews.Title: “nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frugby1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty new , nicely furnished. just across from Novartis Turkey. The breakfast was good, but nothing special. The location is good if you are flying from/to the Gokcen airport, but it is VERY far away from the center of Istanbul . For the evening, there is a nice shopping center next door (always good to bring back some gifts to the family). bottom line: It is a pretty expensive hotel for Istanbul, and far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on asia side for families”
Reviews.Author: pknrajasthan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in This hotel and its a very comfotable property : Best part is that its attached to a very big shopping mall so all shopping can be done with nice brands there , also families with kids are kept busy in a attached theme park which is very convienent for kids .. Large rooms , wifi free of charge , good restaurant and nice spread of breakfast Its very good for people who land at the second airport of istanbul .. on asia side and those who are connecting to other points in istanbul.. through that second airport .. though checkin took time but thats fine .. It has a very large pool and very nice one too which is indoor .. so one can swim in winters too ..

Reviews.Title: “No stable quality”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: Two weeks stay in this hotel for business in June. I rank it 4 out of 5 as amenities are good, very good for some (try the health club), and it is clearly the best hotel in the neighbourhood (close to Sabiha Gokcen & Viaport). Some disturbing problems here and there: club lounge is below international hotels standards and length of check-out process is shockingly high. Some employees training or additional staffing would be welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring food into this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Garious
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at this property and the first since Crown Plaza has taken over managing it. It is a nice hotel located next to an outlet mall and amusement center. It has a really good workout area and pool. The food in the restaurant is reasonable for the price. The major issue I had at the hotel this stay is that they now do not allow outside food or beverage to be brought into the hotel. Imagine my surprise when I entered the hotel after shopping in the mall with a bag of chips and a pop only to learn that outside food was not allowed in the hotel or the room (the chips and pop in the mini-bar is allowed). I was instructed by security to go to reception before going to my room. I went there and was told that even the packaged food that I had purchased to take home as gifts were not allowed in my room and that I should bring everything I had down to reception and they would hold it for me until I checked-out. Initially I thought they were joking but they were serious. I saw one guest that was publicly embarrassed by the staff about the food they had brought into the hotel. I attempted to contact management about the policy but have yet to obtain a response. The above issue turned a great stay into an irritation. Due to this I will probably never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place bad service”
Reviews.Author: hgoda5
Reviews.Content: a quite nice place to stay but very bad service no body from the hotel staff are smiling at all, food from the restaurant very expensive bad taste and late(order a pie pizza toke an hour and half after complaining to the manager ) , very bad English ( I ask for iron and ironing board they send me a drink), far a way ( one hour) from downtown Istanbul .

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, sadly isn't.”
Reviews.Author: MasterControlProgram
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at this hotel to be a mix of pleasure and pain with some nice features let down by some terrible policies and service. First, the good: My room on the second floor was very spacious, bright with a large comfortable king-size bed and well-appointed bathroom with two showers, one walk-in and one in the bath. A decent sized LCD TV (that I didn't actually use) and a large window overlooking the shopping outlets. Breakfast was excellent with a large slection of fresh meats, cheeses, fruit, olives, many types of bread, breakfast pastries and cereals. There were a few chefs in the dining area with some hot food but as I never sampled them, I couldn't comment on that. I used room service a few times in the evening and the food was okay. Not great but certainly not bad. The service was a mixed bag - most of the hotel staff would give you a hello/good morning and a smile. A few didn't and almost seemed to begrudge you being there.. perhaps they were having a bad day at the time, whatever. The location is good or bad depending what you want to do - for my purposes it was very convenient and the position of the hotel towering over a large outlets shopping centre with food court was quite nice. However, if you are using this hotel as a base of touring Istanbul, I wouldn't call it convenient with a taxi fare of up to 80TL to get to the most popular tourist areas on the European side (although it's possible to do this cheaply with a 10TL taxi to Sabiha Gokcen airport and then a 12TL Havas bus to Taksim - just be aware it's about an hour's ride). My final positive note is regarding the fitness centre -the equipment is top notch with just about every type you could want and many of the machines (rowing and treadmills of which there were plenty) have large touch screen interfaces into which you can plug your iPod/iPhone and play music and even watch movies through). Now for the bad and I apologize if this sounds like a rant in places: I travel a lot - I've stayed in many hotels (i usually try and stay in ICHG hotels for the points but there were no nearby options here) and I have a fairly typical routine when staying away. One of the first things I usualy do is to try and secure an iron & ironing board to iron all my shirts and any other clothing that can be ironed - my packing isn't the worst but I still find that my clothing rarely survives sans-wrinkles when travelling. As I didn't arrive at the hotel until very late (after 2am), I left it until next morning. However, when I called down to housekeeping in the morning and asked for an iron, I was told there were none available (they only have one for all guests apparently!) and they'd be happy to iron my shirts for me (for a fee of course). Now, I'm perfectly capable of ironing my own shirts and I have never - not once - had an issue like this before. Of course, having little choice (as my travel iron had also died), I submitted two shirts to housekeeping. On the evening of the 3rd day, I did get an iron/board which i then used to iron everything assuming the iron would be removed next day for another guest (if they really do have just the one). It wasn't and in fact remained in my room for the rest of the week - I just hope there wasn't some other poor guest needing an iron during that time. Next up.. during my stay, I spent one of the weekend days in my room catching up with some documentation. As such, around lunchtime, I dedcided to pop down to the convenience store for a couple of cans of soft drink and a bag of Doritos. On my return back to the hotel, the doorman asked to check the carrier bag and on seeing the contents said firmly "FORBIDDEN!" I thought he was playing some kind of joke but he went in and got the girl from the health spa out who spoke slightly better english and she explained that food and drink are not allowed to be brought into the hotel. Hotel policy (which isn't anywhere on the website or on any literature in the room by the way). Again, I've never experienced this before anywhere - I could understand it if I were trying to bring in, say - a big pizza or MacDonalds, but a packet of crisps and can of diet coke? Ridiculous. Then there's the noise. As I said previously, my room was comfortable. However, despite the website promising sound proof windows, there's quite a bit of noise coming in from the nearby highway as well as any loud music from the shopping centre. Even if the windows were properly soundproofed, the ocassional banging and (what sounded like drilling) from within the hotel coupled with the late night club music (way past midnight were maddening at times. There were also a few small niggles.. firstly, the walk-in shower had a tendency to leak water all over the rest of the bathroom floor.. not sure if this is supposed to happen (smooth shiny floor with no obvious drain so I suspected not) but it took a while to drain so I ended up using the one in the bath. Also, the WiFi was a little temperamental - I almost always had a signal but having a signal didin't necessarily mean you'd have any kind of connection to any sites - sometimes you;d get a slow or non-moving loading bar that you just had to wait out. Then when accessing some sites, I'd be presented with a page that seemed to suggest this site was banned (Youtube and a few others). Later on in the week, some of these sites were accessible again then next day not. Oh and don't bother looking for the outdoor pool. At the time of writing, it's not finished and won't be till next year/2011 (despite what it says on the official hotel website). Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “dream place”
Reviews.Author: baha75
Reviews.Content: i was there last june, with my family. it was first time for us to be be in istanbul and we choese this hotel after advice from my friend. we enjoy the place .. it was avery nice vacation. i hope to go there again. we like it too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Coolboy6929
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Via port hotel and I can summarize like below: 1- We were there to see Formula-1 races which took place in Istanbul-Park, so if you are going to see some race in Istanbul-Park, it's the perfect place you can stay. 2- You have 2 hours of driving from Ataturk Airport to Via port hotel. in Traffic rush hour+any car accident , you may stuck in traffic for more than 3 hours. 3- The hotel is a brand new one, just constructed therefore it's very clean. 4- No pool available but we have been told it's under construction. 5- Huge shopping center, including all brand outlet are just next to hotel. so no need to go anywhere in Istanbul . anything you want is in 2 minutes from your room. 6- the hotel people, incl receptions can speak with you in English and they are very friendly. 7- The breakfast is perfect, never miss it.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Istanbul Asia
HotelInfo.Address: Dedepasa Caddesi No:15 Viaport, Istanbul 34912, Turkey (Formerly Via Hotel)
